title: Delhi High Court to examine limits of free speech by social media influencers
selftext: Our courts a bunch of fucking clowns
comments: What crap...i thought this must be something related to false claims or advertising or something. But this is about limiting free speech aka telling facts about products

*reasonable limitations on free speech for the sake of public order, decency, morality, and other factors*

Wow. All to protect big companies who lie to their customers. Right now I am feeling very good that I've never had bournvita but I am now deeply suspicious about all the packaged foods in my pantry although I feel I've spent half my life reading labels off these jars

No wonder.

Reasons:

1. Sci-Hub case verdict 

2. ANI vs Wikipedia verdict
